name: 林顯易
objective: This course consists of lectures on the theory of digital signal processing (DSP). In the beginning of this course, digital-time signals, systems, and transforms are reviewed. Also, digital filter design including FIR and IIR filters are presented. Then, application implementation on speech, audio, and image processing is introduced.
schedule:
Weeks 　　Topics
1　　Introduction, basic concepts of DSP
2　　Discrete-time linear systems 
3　　Discrete-time linear systems 
4　　Z-transform
5　　Z-transform
6　　Discrete-time Fourier transform (DTFT)
7　　Discrete-time Fourier transform (DTFT)
8　　Frequency selective linear filtering and sample theorem
9　　Sampling and Reconstruction Signals
10　　Mid-Term Exam
11　　Discrete Fourier transform (DFT)
12　　Discrete Fourier transform (DFT)
13　　Fast Fourier Transform (FFT)
14　　Implementation Discrete-Time Systems
15　　FIR filter design
16　　IIR filter design
17　　Introduction of TI C28xx DSPs and their developmental tools
18　　Final Exam
scorePolicy:
1 mid-term examination                      40% 
 1 final examination                         40%
 1 final project                             20%
materials: Textbook: J. G. Proakis and D. G. Manolakis, Digital Signal Processing: Principles, Algorithms, and Applications, Prentice-Hall, NJ, Fourth Edition, 2007.
